title: Saint Calvados finally wins at Cheltenham
text:
Saint Calvados exorcised his Cheltenham ghost when making the most of a drop in class to provide Harry Whittington with his first winner there in the Randox Health Handicap Chase.

Having suffered defeats in the 2018 Arkle and last year’s Champion Chase at the track, the six-year-old made it third time lucky when carrying top weight to triumph on his seasonal return in the two-mile contest.

Taking up matters just before the last, the 5/2 favourite, who had undergone a wind operation over the summer, was forced to pull out all the stops to defeat Vaniteux by a length.

Whittington said: “That was my first Cheltenham winner. It’s very special. He handled the track. He loved those conditions. It was a classy performance in those conditions off top weight. It was a big drop in class. He was able to breathe today and was in his comfort zone the whole way. [jockey] Gavin [Sheehan] said he jumped the last and was a little bit lonely and needed something to come to him.”

Watching videos of Ruby Walsh riding around Cheltenham paid dividends for Harry Cobden as Quel Destin (5/2) left his odds-on defeat on the Flat at Bath 10 days ago well behind him when taking the Masterson Holdings Hurdle by three-quarters of a length.
